kerasgenerator

    • Data Generator for Supervised Time Series

Set/modify a generator's mode

generator_mode.Rd

Set/modify a generator's mode

generator_mode(x, new_mode)

Arguments

x

A generator generated using kerasgenerator.
new_mode

new mode that would be assigned to the generator.

Value

An modified data generator (copied as new environment)

Details

soon updated

Examples


# import library
library(kerasgenerator)

# create example data
sunspots_df <- as.data.frame(sunspots)

# setup a generator
data_gen <- flow_series_from_dataframe(
  data = sunspots_df,
  x = "x",
  y = "x",
  length_out = 1,
  stride = 1,
  lookback = 1,
  timesteps = 12,
  batch_size = 32,
  mode = "training"
)

# check generator mode
generator_meta(data_gen, "mode")
#> [1] "training"

# modify generator mode
data_gen_modified <- generator_mode(data_gen, "prediction")

# compare old and new generators
generator_meta(data_gen, "mode")
#> [1] "training"
generator_meta(data_gen_modified, "mode")
#> [1] "prediction"
